page.title: 02CRANHAM VILLAGE
page.content: Cranham is a wide spread village with clumps of houses dotted about it.Cranham is mostly woods and common. There are three pubs in Cranham the names of these pubs are the Royal William,Fostons Ash and the Black Horse.There is a Cricket Club. { Cranham has a School and a Church.The population of the village is about 470. There is a feast every year which anyone can go to. There are four main groups of houses in Cranham. They are called The Knoll, Church Close, the main village and Cranham Corner. There is a playing field with a tennis court and a football pitch and swings etc. There is a fish farm and it is called Brook Farm. There are two big lakes and a pond. People go down there to fish. Cranham School isn't very big, it has only 35 pupils. Freams Farm produces the milk for the villagers.
